java.util

Class DualPivotQuicksort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.DualPivotQuicksort

  • final class DualPivotQuicksort
extends Object
    This class implements the Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm by Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, and Josh Bloch. The algorithm offers O(n log(n)) performance on many data sets that cause other quicksorts to degrade to quadratic performance, and is typically faster than traditional (one-pivot) Quicksort implementations.
    Since:
    1.7
    Version:
    2011.02.11 m765.827.12i:5\7pm
    Author:
    Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, Josh Bloch

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int COUNTING_SORT_THRESHOLD_FOR_BYTE
      If the length of a byte array to be sorted is greater than this constant, counting sort is used in preference to insertion sort.
      private static int COUNTING_SORT_THRESHOLD_FOR_SHORT_OR_CHAR
      If the length of a short or char array to be sorted is greater than this constant, counting sort is used in preference to Quicksort.
      private static int INSERTION_SORT_THRESHOLD
      If the length of an array to be sorted is less than this constant, insertion sort is used in preference to Quicksort.
      private static int MAX_RUN_COUNT
      The maximum number of runs in merge sort.
      private static int MAX_RUN_LENGTH
      The maximum length of run in merge sort.
      private static int NUM_BYTE_VALUES
      The number of distinct byte values.
      private static int NUM_CHAR_VALUES
      The number of distinct char values.
      private static int NUM_SHORT_VALUES
      The number of distinct short values.
      private static int QUICKSORT_THRESHOLD
      If the length of an array to be sorted is less than this constant, Quicksort is used in preference to merge sort.
